body:
Thanks for posting in our issue tracker.
In order to properly assist you, we need additional information:

- When does the issue occur?
- What do you see?
- What was the expected result?
- Can you supply us with a stacktrace? (optional)
- Do you have exact code to reproduce it? Maybe a PHPUnit tests that fails? (optional)

Thanks!

_This is an automated comment, triggered by adding the label `status:need more info`._

### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Problem occures when I call Yii::getLogger()->getProfiling() in web controller's action.

### What is the expected result?

expecting an array as an result of Yii::getLogger()->getProfiling();

### What do you get instead?

```
md5() expects parameter 1 to be string, array given

#0 /private/var/www/system.local/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/log/Logger.php(211): yii\log\Logger->calculateTimings('???')
#1 /private/var/www/system.local/platform/core/base/Profiler.php(46): yii\log\Logger->getProfiling()

```
Seems, yii\log\Logger::calculateTimings gets an array ['rule' => '...', 'match' => false, 'parent' => null] in $token var, instead of expected string. The array was sent by UrlManager on line 271 in method parseRequest

Reproduced. Steps:

1. Install basic project template.
2. Enable URL manager.
3. Call `Yii::getLogger()->getProfiling()` in web controller's action.
I'm sorry, it's my bad. Fix coming.

issue.title: md5 token serialized

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:

| ------------- | ---

| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #14264

body: @mvkasatkin does it happen w/o calling a method manually?
@samdark, no, without calling manually it is ok. My project's specified profiler use it and fails. try/catch helps as a workaround.
OK. It's now fixed but I guess a workaround is necessary for now.

With deea182 fix throwing an exception in controller causes another error:
```
An Error occurred while handling another error:
Exception: Serialization of 'Closure' is not allowed in /**/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/log/Logger.php:281
```
While without it exception is properly handled. 

To reproduce, add in controller action:
`throw new \yii\web\BadRequestHttpException();`
And in response component configuration:
```
'response' => [
    ...
     'on beforeSend' => function ($event) {
        Yii::getLogger()->getProfiling();
    },
]
```

Is this an expected behavior and exception should be handled another way?

issue.title: Fixed regression in error handling introduced by fixing #14264

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

body: @xf3 reproduced and fixed. Please check if it works well.
@samdark seems to be working fine. Thanks!
